results.title: Seeing the future
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Management Techniques”.
One of a series of films about some of the problems of forecasting, and of trying to achieve control through forecasts, particularly in the case of small and medium-sized firms. Intuition and detached statistical forecasts are both highly vulnerable to the unexpected. Unless this limitation can be overcome, forecasting is of no use to management.

results.title: Seeing It Our Way
results.brief_description: A sensitive program which gives viewers an insight into the daily lives of visually impaired people and shows how best to assist such people, especially the elderly. Simulated vision segments give viewers a true appreciation of what it is like to be visually impaired. The program covers hazards, clothes and storage, communication issues and myths, “sighted guide” techniques and more.

results.title: Seeing is believing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
A “Four Corners” program which discusses the different attitudes people have towards television and newspapers. The editor of The Age newspaper gives his views on the reason for the poor credibility rating of newspapers as against that of television. Includes commentary by Graeme Perkins, Mike Willesee, John Temple and Ross Symonds.

results.title: Seeing by numbers
results.creator_credit: Bob Thorpe, London Television Service and Janice Kay
results.brief_description: Presents the history of information from the 13th century and the new ways we can communicate. Shows everyday applications of numerical analysis in such areas as weather forecasting, telephone information systems, education and business.

results.title: Seeing and hearing
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
Designed for 11 to 14 year olds, the film illustrates the eye and the ear, using resources not available in the classroom or school laboratory. Uses clinical techniques, anatomical models and preparations selected to demonstrate body functions.

results.title: Seeing a sound
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Jane Passy, a speech therapist, explains how valuable her system of cued articulation can be in primary education in helping children to learn the consonant sounds of the English language. The method involves hand movements to demonstrate the physical actions of speech.

results.title: Seeing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Seeing involves both the eyes and the brain. The development of seeing and the beginning of visual awareness are discussed. An eye specialist explains how the eye works and stresses the importance of the early detection of eye problems. Eye tests are demonstrated and the problems associated with glasses discussed. We examine common childhood ailments and injuries, parents talk about their visually impaired children and some advice is offered by an early childhood specialist.

group_siblings.creator_credit: Charles Cahill, Charles Cahill and Associates and Macko Productions

results.title: Seeds of violence
results.brief_description: Examines the causes of violence and destruction and shows how violence operates in a cycle which in turn stimulates retaliation and revenge. Shows how the violent urge exists in childhood as well as adulthood, focusing on bullying in the schoolground and male to female violence in teenagers - both verbal and physical abuse. Covers the topic of boredom as the reason for violent destructive behaviour. Contains some animated scenes. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
